results.title: Build yourself a world H.S.
results.creator_credit: Richard Need, John R.F. Stewart and Stewart's Films
results.brief_description: Traces the evolution of civil engineering, from man’s first tools to the structures of today. Shows that the present day civil engineer designs his project not only as a functional structure but also to take its place in its surroundings

results.title: The Build up
results.creator_credit: Gerard Bryant, Terry Trench and Derek Stewart Productions
results.brief_description: This film shows how misunderstandings arising from poor instruction and supervision can lead to an industrial dispute and strike.

results.title: The Bugaku dance
results.brief_description: An introduction to “Bugaku” or Japanese Imperial Court dance and music, which have been preserved in the Imperial Court for centuries. It contains performances of “Ryoo”, a solo dance played with the use of masks, and “Bairo”, a mass dance. Music only - no narration.

results.title: Budget cuts
results.brief_description: Produced by Oxo, in association with the National Federation of Meat Traders Association, this is a demonstration of cooking, and the attractive arrangement of low-cost dishes. A butcher explains and shows various cuts of meat; emphasizes the value of cheaper cuts and how they can be used to advantage. No other credits available.

results.title: The Buddhist world
results.brief_description: Reviews the origins of Buddhism through the life, work, and philosophy of Gautama Buddha; gives an understanding of the major doctrines of Buddhist belief; traces the historical and cultural growth of Buddhism, and shows its influence in those lands where it is practiced today - India, Thailand, Japan and Tibet.

results.title: Buddhism in China
results.brief_description: The rise of Buddhism in China is traced from its beginning in 4 BC. The film gives a good outline of Buddha’s philosophy and teaching, the further changes and the new sects. The film is narrated by Alexander Scourby.

results.title: Brute force and finesse: new ways of shaping and forming materials
results.creator_credit: Max Morgan-Witts and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Recent advances in manufacturing techniques, including electron beam welding, explosive forming, spark machining, hydrostatic extrusion, and cold forming are demonstrated in this film.

results.title: Brush techniques
results.brief_description: This is the second of a series of films on water colour painting which have been made in collaboration with Eliot O’Hara; the companion film, the first in the series, is “Painting reflections in water”. In “Brush techniques”, O’Hara executes a water colour sketch in order to demonstrate how he communicates his impression of a landscape to whose who view his paintings.

results.title: Brush Creek bounces back
results.creator_credit: Stuart Finley and State of West Virginia, Dept of Commerce
results.brief_description: Illustrates how the Brush Creek Small Watershed Project converted the valley into an award winning example of good conservation practices. This enhanced land values, provided new recreation facilities and created new jobs.
